item.title: Onton raises $7.5M to expand its AI-powered shopping site beyond furniture
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Onton, which change its name from Deft, is giving users an infinite canvas with AI-powered image generation to nudge them towards making quicker purchase decisions

item.title: Uber and WeRide’s robotaxi service in Abu Dhabi is officially driverless
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The commercial robotaxi service launched last year. Now, the human safety operator is gone.

item.title: Why ‘hold forever’ investors are snapping up venture capital ‘zombies’
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: An investor explains the "buy, fix, and hold" model employed by Bending Spoons and similar companies that buy distressed startups.

item.title: YouTube is working on a feature that will fix the messy home feed
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: YouTube is experimenting with a new feature that allows users to customize their home feed.

item.title: Character AI will offer interactive ‘Stories’ to kids instead of open-ended chat
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: The company announced last month that it would no longer allow minors to use its chat features.

item.title: ChatGPT’s voice mode is no longer a separate interface
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: ChatGPT now lets you use voice and text in the same screen, making conversations feel more natural as responses and visuals appear in real time.

item.title: Warner Music signs deal with AI music startup Suno, settles lawsuit
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: WMG says artists and songwriters will have full control over whether and how their names, images, likenesses, voices,Â and compositions are used in new AI-generated music.

item.title: OpenAI and Perplexity are launching AI shopping assistants, but competing startups aren’t sweating it
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Startup founders building AI shopping tools think general-purpose models are too broad to deliver truly personalized shopping experiences.

item.title: Find Your Grind raises $5M to grow platform empowering students to explore unique career paths
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Nick Gross says that Find Your Grind gives students the tools to explore what careers are out there and what paths suit their strengths, interests, and visions for what they want their futures to look like.

item.title: Microsoft’s AI chatbot Copilot leaves WhatsApp on January 15
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: WhatsApp's new platform policies ban general-purpose AI chatbots like Copilot from using its service.

item.title: China’s Pony AI plans to triple global robotaxi fleet by the end of 2026
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The Chinese autonomous vehicle company Pony.ai has global ambitions and plans to build a 3,000-strong robotaxi fleet to meet them.

item.title: Fleet Space finds massive lithium deposit using AI and satellites
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The discovery suggests that a region in Quebec might hold even more lithium than originally suspected.

item.title: Speechify adds voice typing and voice assistant to its Chrome extension
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: In the last 12 months, there has been a proliferation of voice detection tools, thanks to overall quality improvement in speech recognition models. Speechify is hitching its wagon to this train and launching its own dictation tool with support for English.

item.title: Spotify to raise US prices in first quarter of next year, report says
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Major record labels have been urging Spotify and other music streaming platforms to raise subscription prices, arguing that fees have not kept pace with inflation and remain low when compared to services like Netflix.

item.title: India’s gig workers win legal status, but access to social security remains elusive
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: India is restructuring its gig economy with a new labor law, but much more is needed before gig workers see real benefits.

item.title: Google teams up with Accel to hunt for India’s next AI breakouts
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Google and Accel will jointly invest up to $2 million in each startup through their new partnership.

item.title: Altman describes OpenAI’s forthcoming AI device as more peaceful and calm than the iPhone
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Altman and Ive tease a simple AI device aimed at calm, distraction-free computing, launching within two years.

item.title: OpenAI learned the hard way that Cameo trademarked the word ‘cameo’
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: OpenAI might have to rename the "cameo" feature in the Sora app.

item.title: Rad Power Bikes’ batteries receive major fire risk warning
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The U.S Consumer Product Safety Commission claims Rad Power "refused to agree to an acceptable recall." Rad Power says the CPSC's solution would bankrupt the company.

item.title: Tesla FSD software may not be approved by EU regulator after all
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Tesla claimed in a weekend social media post that a Dutch regulator was set to approve its Full Self-Driving mode. It seems the regulator isn't quite in line with Tesla.
